div1.p: Lydia Hotchkiss writes to her children, relating information about agricultural prospects, health and illnesses, and other local news.

div1.head:
Will the general be pleased to Send this on
My Mother - Dec. 28-1861 Came thro' lines of enemy
div1.p:
it is a long time since I have heard from you We want to hear from you all verry much your fathers health is verry poor and mine is not as good as usual my eyesight failing verry fast I do not no as you can read it well we are having the measels in this town a great many have them none have died With them here georges Children has Been quite sick But are getting along there has Been a great many old people Died the past year this has Been a verry fruitful year grain is abundant and everry thing But apples we had a plenty more than all the rest of the neighbors We have milked eightteen Cows this Sumer Butter has not Been as high as it was some years every thing is Cheap here Senna and family are well your Aunt alma has gone to live with Edgar at Ursadella fork all the friends are well here Bird and Almina are married Mr. russel has Been sick this fall Came over on a visit and Was sick a While olivers health is poor - he is teaching school Below here this Winter
Mrs Comforts health is verry good She Lives by herself in a house Below Mrs macunes Mrs Macunes health is poor this Winter We are having verry Cold Weather here We heard from Suraense a few days ago your Aunt Shirley is almost Blind she Cannot see But verry Little Jus Peasants wife keeps house for them your Aunt Malindas and family are well as usual and Dwight Shaw Been to see them all this Winter now he write as soon as you Can how I would like to Step in and see you all I often think of you all and and often Dream of you But awake to to Disapointment kiss all the Children for granma We Send Love to you all do Write soon as you
